intro: Pisonia bonairensis, commonly known as the Bonaire glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Bonaire. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pink bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are simple and opposite. Pisonia bonairensis thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils.
